Instruction:
Task Description: Create a Java class that implements an ActiveMQ message consumer capable of receiving messages from a specified queue, processing different message types (TextMessage and BytesMessage), and handling connection exceptions.

Class Description: The ActiveMqConsumer class implements Runnable and ExceptionListener interfaces to asynchronously consume messages from an ActiveMQ broker while handling connection exceptions. It manages the JMS connection lifecycle and provides methods to start/stop the consumer.

Attributes:
- connection: Connection - JMS connection to the ActiveMQ broker
- session: Session - JMS session for message processing
- consumer: MessageConsumer - JMS message consumer for receiving messages
- remoteUri: String - URI of the ActiveMQ broker
- queueName: String - Name of the queue to consume messages from

Methods:
- ActiveMqConsumer(String remoteUri, String queueName) -> None - Constructor that initializes the broker URI and queue name
- start() -> void - Creates connection factory, establishes connection, creates session and consumer
- stop() -> void - Closes consumer, session and connection resources
- run() -> void - Continuously receives and processes messages (TextMessage/BytesMessage)
- onException(JMSException e) -> void - Exception handler that stops the consumer on connection errors
- getConnection() -> Connection - Returns the JMS connection
- getSession() -> Session - Returns the JMS session
- getConsumer() -> MessageConsumer - Returns the message consumer

Task Description: Create a Java class that provides read-only access to file contents using MemorySegment and FileChannel for efficient memory-mapped file operations.

Class Description: MemorySegmentReaderSupplier is a utility class that implements ReaderSupplier interface, designed to provide memory-mapped file reading capabilities. It uses Java NIO's FileChannel to map a file into memory as a MemorySegment, allowing efficient read operations. The class manages memory resources through an Arena and automatically handles resource cleanup.

Attributes:
- arena: Arena - Manages the lifecycle of the memory segment and ensures proper cleanup
- memory: MemorySegment - The memory-mapped representation of the file content

Methods:
- Constructor: MemorySegmentReaderSupplier(Path path) throws IOException - Initializes the reader by opening the specified file and mapping it into memory. Throws IOException if file operations fail.
- get: get() -> MemorySegmentReader - Returns a new MemorySegmentReader instance for accessing the memory-mapped file content
- close: close() -> void - Releases all allocated resources by closing the arena and unmapping the memory segment

Task Description: Create a Java class that handles HTTP requests for sending debug information to a server, including handling redirects and SSL connections.

Class Description: HttpDebugIdSender is a utility class designed to send debug information to a specified server URL using HTTP POST requests. It handles JSON payload construction, SSL connections (when needed), and follows redirects if necessary. The class includes error logging and proper resource cleanup.

Attributes:
- distinctId: String - Unique identifier for the debug session
- infoId: String - Additional information ID to be included in the URL
- serverUrl: String - Base URL of the server to which debug information will be sent

Methods:
- HttpDebugIdSender(String serverUrl, String distinctId, String infoId) -> None - Constructor that initializes the class with server URL, distinct ID, and info ID
- send() -> None - Initiates the HTTP request to send debug information
- sendHttpRequest(String serverUrl, boolean isRedirects) -> None - Internal method that handles the actual HTTP request, including connection setup, payload sending, and response handling
- closeStream(ByteArrayOutputStream out, OutputStream out2, BufferedOutputStream bout, HttpURLConnection connection) -> None - Helper method to safely close all open streams and connections

Task Description: Create a Java class that demonstrates how to make an HTTP request using HttpURLConnection, including setting connection timeouts and request headers, and handling the response.

Class Description: The CleartextHttpCredentialsTest class is designed to test basic HTTP connectivity with a target URL. It demonstrates how to establish a connection, set timeouts, add request headers, and retrieve response information. The class focuses on proper resource cleanup after the connection is used.

Attributes:
- TARGET: [String] - A constant storing the URL to which the HTTP request will be made

Methods:
- runTest: [runTest]() -> [void] - Executes the HTTP request to the target URL. Sets connection timeouts, adds an Authorization header, retrieves the response code and message, and ensures proper connection cleanup. Throws Exception if any step fails.

Task Description: Create a Java class that implements HTTP client functionality using HttpURLConnection for making HTTP requests and handling responses.

Class Description: The Http class provides a static method for sending HTTP requests to a specified URL with configurable request methods and payloads. It handles connection setup, request sending, response reading, and resource cleanup.

Methods:

Method1: httpsRequest(String requestUrl, String requestMethod, String outputStr) -> String - Sends an HTTP request to the specified URL using the given method and optional request body, then returns the response as a string.
  - requestUrl: String - The target URL for the HTTP request
  - requestMethod: String - The HTTP method to use (e.g., "GET", "POST")
  - outputStr: String - The request body to send (can be null for requests without body)
  - Returns: String - The response body from the server, or null if an error occurs

The method handles:
1. Creating and configuring HttpURLConnection
2. Setting request headers (content-type: text/xml; charset=UTF-8)
3. Sending request body if provided
4. Reading and concatenating response
5. Proper resource cleanup
6. Error handling and logging

Task Description: Create a Java class that handles HTTP requests asynchronously to fetch and process JSON data from a given URL.

Class Description: HttpRequestHandler is a utility class that contains nested classes and methods for performing asynchronous HTTP requests and processing JSON responses. The main functionality is implemented through an AsyncTask subclass to avoid blocking the main thread during network operations.

Attributes: 
(None - This is a utility class with no instance attributes)

Methods:

Method1: MyAsyncTaskgetNews(String... params) -> String - A nested AsyncTask class that performs HTTP GET requests in the background. It takes a URL as input, establishes a connection, retrieves data, and processes the response.

Method2: onProgressUpdate(String... progress) -> void - A callback method that processes the received JSON data during the task's execution. It parses the JSON array and extracts individual JSON objects.

Method3: onPostExecute(String result2) -> void - A callback method that handles post-execution tasks after the background operation completes.

Method4: ConvertInputToStringNoChange(InputStream inputStream) -> String - A helper method that converts an InputStream into a String by reading all lines from the input stream and concatenating them.

Task Description: Create a Java class that reads and processes OSM (OpenStreetMap) PBF (Protocolbuffer Binary Format) files using Java NIO's FileChannel for efficient file operations, with support for lazy reading of file blocks.

Class Description: The OsmInputFile class provides functionality to read and process OSM PBF files. It supports both eager and lazy reading modes, where lazy reading defers the actual decoding of data blocks until needed. The class uses FileChannel for efficient file operations and includes methods for reading headers, blocks, and validating file contents.

Attributes:
- path: [Path] - The file path to the OSM PBF file to be processed
- lazy: [boolean] - Flag indicating whether to use lazy reading mode for file blocks

Methods:
- readInt: [readInt]([FileChannel channel]) -> [int] - Reads a 4-byte integer from the specified FileChannel
- readBytes: [readBytes]([FileChannel channel, int length]) -> [byte[]] - Reads a specified number of bytes from the current position in the FileChannel
- readBytes: [readBytes]([FileChannel channel, long offset, int length]) -> [byte[]] - Reads a specified number of bytes from a specific offset in the FileChannel
- readBlobHeader: [readBlobHeader]([FileChannel channel]) -> [BlobHeader] - Reads and parses a BlobHeader from the FileChannel
- openChannel: [openChannel]() -> [FileChannel] - Opens and returns a FileChannel for reading the input file
- LazyReader (inner class): [LazyReader]() -> [OsmBlockSource] - Implements lazy reading functionality for OSM blocks
  - forEachBlock: [forEachBlock]([Consumer<Block> consumer]) -> [void] - Processes each block in the file using the provided consumer
  - close: [close]() -> [void] - Closes the lazy reading channel
  - LazyBlock (inner record): [LazyBlock]([long offset, int length, FileChannel channel]) -> [Block] - Represents a lazily-read block
    - decodeElements: [decodeElements]() -> [Iterable<OsmElement>] - Decodes the block's elements when accessed

Task Description: Implement a custom HTTP data source for streaming media that handles connection management, redirects, and error handling, specifically designed for YouTube video streaming.

Class Description: YoutubeHttpDataSource is a custom HTTP data source implementation that extends BaseDataSource and implements HttpDataSource interface. It provides functionality for opening and closing HTTP connections, handling redirects, and managing input streams for media streaming.

Attributes:

allowCrossProtocolRedirects: boolean - Determines whether cross-protocol redirects (HTTP to HTTPS or vice versa) are allowed
connectTimeoutMillis: int - Connection timeout in milliseconds
readTimeoutMillis: int - Read timeout in milliseconds
requestProperties: RequestProperties - Contains HTTP request headers and properties
dataSpec: DataSpec - Contains information about the data to be read
connection: HttpURLConnection - The active HTTP connection
inputStream: InputStream - The input stream for reading data
opened: boolean - Flag indicating whether the data source is currently open

Methods:

open(DataSpec dataSpecParameter) -> long - Opens the data source for the specified DataSpec and returns the length of the data
makeConnection(DataSpec dataSpecToUse) -> HttpURLConnection - Creates and configures an HTTP connection, handling redirects
openConnection(URL url) -> HttpURLConnection - Opens a basic HTTP connection to the specified URL
handleRedirect(URL originalUrl, String location, DataSpec dataSpecToHandleRedirect) -> URL - Handles HTTP redirects and returns the new URL
close() -> void - Closes the data source and releases all resources
maybeTerminateInputStream(HttpURLConnection connection, long bytesRemaining) -> void - Helper method to terminate input streams on specific Android versions
closeConnectionQuietly() -> void - Safely closes the current connection without throwing exceptions

Task Description: Create a Java class that implements a RESTful client using HttpURLConnection to perform HTTP requests (GET, POST, PUT) and handle responses.

Class Description: The `RestfulClient` class provides methods to execute HTTP requests (GET, POST, PUT) to a specified URL and process the responses. It handles connection setup, request parameter configuration, input/output stream management, and connection cleanup.

Attributes: None

Methods:

Method1: `get(String path) -> String` - Executes a GET request to the specified URL path and returns the response as a String.  
Method2: `post(String path, String requestBody) -> String` - Executes a POST request to the specified URL path with the provided request body and returns the response as a String.  
Method3: `put(String path, String requestBody) -> String` - Executes a PUT request to the specified URL path with the provided request body and returns the response as a String.  
Method4: `executeRequest(String method, String path, String requestBody) -> String` - Internal helper method that handles the common logic for executing HTTP requests (connection setup, request configuration, and response processing).  
Method5: `getVal(RestfulRequest request) -> String` - Executes a custom HTTP request based on the provided `RestfulRequest` object (containing URL, method, and parameters) and returns the response as a String.  

Input:  
- For `get`, `post`, and `put`:  
  - `path` (String): The target URL for the HTTP request.  
  - `requestBody` (String, optional for POST/PUT): The request payload in JSON format.  
- For `getVal`:  
  - `request` (RestfulRequest): An object encapsulating the request details (URL, HTTP method, and parameters).  

Output:  
- String: The response body from the HTTP request, or `null` if an error occurs.

Task Description: Create a Java class that implements a TCP client using Netty framework to establish a connection with a remote server, send messages, and handle server responses.

Class Description: The TelnetClient class provides functionality to connect to a remote server using TCP, with optional SSL support. It reads input from the console, sends it to the server, and handles the connection lifecycle.

Attributes:
- SSL: boolean - Flag indicating whether SSL encryption should be used
- HOST: String - The host address of the remote server (default: "127.0.0.1")
- PORT: int - The port number of the remote server (default: 8023 or 8992 for SSL)

Methods:
- start(): void - Initializes and starts the TCP client. Handles the connection setup, message sending, and connection teardown. Throws Exception if any error occurs during execution.
  Input: None
  Output: None (void)

Task Description: Create a Java class that implements a TCP client using Netty framework to establish a connection with a remote server, send and receive messages, and handle SSL encryption if required.

Class Description: The EchoClient class is a Netty-based TCP client that connects to a specified server, optionally using SSL encryption, and includes a handler for processing incoming and outgoing messages.

Attributes:
SSL: [boolean] - Flag indicating whether SSL encryption should be used
HOST: [String] - The host address of the server to connect to
PORT: [int] - The port number of the server to connect to
SIZE: [int] - The size parameter for message handling (unused in basic implementation)

Methods:
start: [start]() -> [void] - Initializes and starts the Netty client, establishing a connection to the specified server. Handles SSL context creation if needed, configures the client pipeline, and manages connection lifecycle.
initChannel: [initChannel]([SocketChannel ch]) -> [void] - (Internal method) Configures the channel pipeline with SSL handler (if enabled) and custom client handler during channel initialization.

Task Description: Create a Java class that implements a simple TCP chat client using Netty framework, capable of connecting to a remote server, sending messages from console input, and gracefully shutting down.

Class Description: SimpleChatClient is a Netty-based TCP client that establishes a connection to a specified host and port, sends user input messages to the server, and handles connection lifecycle management.

Attributes:
host: String - The hostname or IP address of the remote server to connect to
port: int - The port number of the remote server to connect to

Methods:
SimpleChatClient: (String host, int port) -> void - Constructor that initializes the client with target host and port
run: () -> void - Main method that initializes Netty components, establishes connection, handles user input, and manages shutdown
    - Initializes NioEventLoopGroup for I/O operations
    - Configures Bootstrap with NioSocketChannel and handler
    - Connects to remote server and maintains channel
    - Reads user input from console and sends to server
    - Handles graceful shutdown of resources

Task Description: Create a Java class that implements a TCP client using Netty framework to establish a secure (optional SSL) connection to a server, send and receive serialized Java objects.

Class Description: ObjectEchoClient is a Netty-based TCP client that connects to a specified server, handles SSL encryption if enabled, and processes object serialization/deserialization for communication. The client maintains the connection until explicitly closed.

Attributes:
SSL: [boolean] - Flag indicating whether SSL encryption should be used
HOST: [String] - The host address of the server to connect to
PORT: [int] - The port number of the server to connect to
SIZE: [int] - The size parameter (unused in current implementation but available for configuration)

Methods:
start: [start]() -> [void] - Initializes and starts the Netty client, establishes connection to server, configures SSL if enabled, sets up object serialization pipeline, and maintains connection until shutdown. Throws Exception if any error occurs during startup or operation.

The method performs the following operations:
1. Creates SSL context if SSL is enabled
2. Initializes NioEventLoopGroup for I/O operations
3. Configures Bootstrap with NioSocketChannel
4. Sets up pipeline with ObjectEncoder, ObjectDecoder and custom handler
5. Connects to specified host and port
6. Maintains connection until channel is closed
7. Shuts down event loop group gracefully when done

Task Description: Create a secure TCP chat client using Java Netty framework that establishes an encrypted connection to a server, sends messages from standard input, and gracefully shuts down when instructed.

Class Description: SecureChatClient is a Netty-based client that handles secure TCP communication with a chat server. It manages connection lifecycle, message sending, and proper resource cleanup.

Attributes:
- HOST: [String] - The server host address (default: "127.0.0.1")
- PORT: [int] - The server port number (default: 8992)
- group: [EventLoopGroup] - Manages client-side I/O threads
- channel: [Channel] - Represents the active network connection
- sslCtx: [SslContext] - SSL context for secure communication

Methods:
- SecureChatClient() -> [void] - Constructor that initializes SSL context and event loop group
- connect() -> [void] - Establishes connection to the server using Bootstrap configuration
- startChat() -> [void] - Starts interactive chat session reading from standard input and sending messages to server
- shutdown() -> [void] - Gracefully shuts down the client and releases resources

Task Description: Create a WebSocket client using Java Netty framework that can establish a connection to a WebSocket server, send and receive frames, and handle connection lifecycle events.

Class Description: WebSocketTestClient is a Netty-based WebSocket client implementation that handles WebSocket connections, frame transmission, and connection management. It supports different WebSocket versions and provides callback mechanisms for frame handling.

Attributes:
- bootstrap: [Bootstrap] - Netty bootstrap instance for client configuration
- ch: [Channel] - Active channel representing the WebSocket connection
- uri: [URI] - Target WebSocket server URI
- version: [WebSocketVersion] - WebSocket protocol version to use
- closed: [boolean] - Connection status flag
- count: [AtomicInteger] - Counter for handler naming

Methods:
- connect(): [WebSocketTestClient] - Establishes connection to WebSocket server, performs handshake, and returns self for chaining
- send(WebSocketFrame frame, FrameListener listener): [WebSocketTestClient] - Sends WebSocket frame and registers listener for response, returns self for chaining
- destroy(): [void] - Gracefully closes connection and releases resources
- destroy(boolean dirty): [void] - Closes connection with option for immediate termination
- isActive(): [boolean] - Returns connection active status
- isOpen(): [boolean] - Returns connection open status
- isWritable(): [boolean] - Returns channel writable status

Nested Interfaces:
- FrameListener: Callback interface for frame reception and error handling
  - onFrame(WebSocketFrame frame): [void] - Called when frame is received
  - onError(Throwable t): [void] - Called when error occurs

Nested Classes:
- WSClientHandler: [SimpleChannelInboundHandler<Object>] - Internal handler for WebSocket handshake and frame processing
  - handshakeFuture(): [ChannelFuture] - Returns handshake completion future
  - handlerAdded(ChannelHandlerContext ctx): [void] - Initializes handshake promise
  - channelActive(ChannelHandlerContext ctx): [void] - Initiates handshake
  - channelRead0(ChannelHandlerContext ctx, Object o): [void] - Processes incoming messages
  - exceptionCaught(ChannelHandlerContext ctx, Throwable cause): [void] - Handles channel errors

Task Description: Create a Java class that implements a TCP client using Netty framework to connect to a server, calculate factorials, and handle secure connections when required.

Class Description: The FactorialClient class establishes a TCP connection to a specified server using Netty's non-blocking I/O. It supports optional SSL encryption and calculates factorials through server communication. The class manages connection lifecycle and resource cleanup.

Attributes:
- SSL: boolean - Flag indicating whether SSL encryption should be used
- HOST: String - The host address of the server to connect to (default: "127.0.0.1")
- PORT: int - The port number of the server (default: 8322)
- COUNT: int - The number for which factorial should be calculated (default: 1000)

Methods:
- start(): void - Initializes the Netty client, establishes connection, handles SSL if enabled, and calculates factorial. Throws Exception if any error occurs during the process.
  - Input: None
  - Output: None (prints factorial result to stderr)
  - Description: Creates event loop group, configures bootstrap with channel type and handler, connects to server, retrieves factorial result from handler, and ensures proper resource cleanup.

Task Description: Create a Java class that implements a Netty-based TCP client for RPC communication, handling connection management, message sending, and resource cleanup.

Class Description: NettyConnectClient is a TCP client implementation using Netty framework for RPC communication. It manages network connections, handles message encoding/decoding, and provides methods for connection validation and resource cleanup.

Attributes:
- group: [EventLoopGroup] - Manages client-side I/O threads and event processing
- channel: [Channel] - Represents the active network connection to the server

Methods:
- init: [void]([String address, Serializer serializer, XxlRpcInvokerFactory xxlRpcInvokerFactory]) -> [void] - Initializes the client connection, sets up the pipeline with encoders/decoders, and establishes connection to the server
- isValidate: [void]() -> [boolean] - Checks if the current connection is active and valid
- close: [void]() -> [void] - Closes the active connection and releases all resources
- send: [void]([XxlRpcRequest xxlRpcRequest]) -> [void] - Sends an RPC request through the established channel

Task Description: Create a Java class that implements a TCP client using Netty framework for establishing non-blocking network connections, sending messages to a server, and handling console input.

Class Description: The EchoClient class provides functionality to connect to a TCP server, send messages, read console input, and gracefully shutdown the connection. It uses Netty's non-blocking I/O model for efficient network communication.

Attributes:
- hostName: [String] - The hostname or IP address of the server to connect to
- portNumber: [int] - The port number of the server to connect to
- group: [EventLoopGroup] - Netty event loop group for managing I/O threads
- channel: [Channel] - The active network channel for communication with the server

Methods:
- connect(): [void]() -> [void] - Initializes the Netty client, connects to the specified server, and sets up the communication pipeline
- sendMessage(): [void]([String message]) -> [void] - Converts the input string to a ByteBuf and sends it to the server through the established channel
- startConsoleInput(): [void]() -> [void] - Starts reading input from the console and sends each line to the server (throws IOException)
- shutdown(): [void]() -> [void] - Gracefully shuts down the client connection and releases resources

Task Description: Implement a Netty-based RPC client in Java that handles remote procedure calls, manages connections, and processes responses asynchronously.

Class Description: NettyRpcClient is a final class that implements RpcRequestTransport interface. It provides functionality for establishing TCP connections using Netty framework, sending RPC requests, and managing client-side communication with a remote server. The class handles connection pooling, request tracking, and graceful shutdown.

Attributes:
- serviceDiscovery: [ServiceDiscovery] - Handles service lookup to find the appropriate server address
- unprocessedRequests: [UnprocessedRequests] - Tracks outstanding RPC requests and their corresponding futures
- channelProvider: [ChannelProvider] - Manages and provides channels for communication
- bootstrap: [Bootstrap] - Netty's client bootstrap configuration
- eventLoopGroup: [EventLoopGroup] - Manages client-side I/O threads

Methods:
- NettyRpcClient() -> [void] - Constructor that initializes the Netty client configuration, including event loop group, bootstrap, and pipeline handlers
- doConnect(InetSocketAddress inetSocketAddress) -> [Channel] - Establishes a connection to the specified remote address and returns the channel
- sendRpcRequest(RpcRequest rpcRequest) -> [Object] - Sends an RPC request to the server and returns a CompletableFuture containing the response
- getChannel(InetSocketAddress inetSocketAddress) -> [Channel] - Retrieves or creates a channel for the specified address
- close() -> [void] - Shuts down the client gracefully and releases resources

Task Description: Implement a Netty-based WebSocket client class that establishes and manages WebSocket connections, handles message sending/receiving, and provides connection status monitoring.

Class Description: NettyWebSocket is a WebSocket client implementation using Netty framework that supports both WS and WSS protocols. It implements the ITransport interface for WebSocket communication, providing connection management, message transmission, and status checking capabilities.

Attributes:
- mChannel: Channel - The active Netty channel for WebSocket communication
- mHandler: NettyWebSocketClientHandler - Custom handler for WebSocket events and messages
- mGroup: NioEventLoopGroup - Netty event loop group for I/O operations
- mUri: String - The WebSocket server URI to connect to
- mOptions: WebSocketOptions - Configuration options for the WebSocket connection

Methods:
- connect(ITransportHandler transportHandler, TransportOptions options) -> void - Establishes a WebSocket connection to the specified URI. Initializes SSL context if needed, creates a handshaker, and sets up the Netty pipeline with necessary handlers.
  Input: 
    - transportHandler: ITransportHandler - Callback handler for transport events
    - options: TransportOptions - Connection-specific options
  Output: None (throws Exception on failure)

- send(byte[] payload, boolean isBinary) -> void - Sends data through the WebSocket connection as either binary or text frame.
  Input:
    - payload: byte[] - The data to send
    - isBinary: boolean - Flag indicating binary (true) or text (false) format
  Output: None

- isOpen() -> boolean - Checks if the WebSocket connection is currently active.
  Input: None
  Output: boolean - True if connection is open, false otherwise

- close() -> void - Closes the WebSocket connection gracefully and releases resources.
  Input: None
  Output: None (throws Exception on failure)

- validateURIAndGetPort(URI uri) -> int - Validates the WebSocket URI and determines the appropriate port.
  Input: uri: URI - The WebSocket URI to validate
  Output: int - The port number to use

- getSSLContext(String scheme) -> SslContext - Creates SSL context for WSS connections.
  Input: scheme: String - The URI scheme ("ws" or "wss")
  Output: SslContext - Configured SSL context or null for WS

- toByteBuf(byte[] bytes) -> ByteBuf - Converts byte array to Netty ByteBuf.
  Input: bytes: byte[] - Data to convert
  Output: ByteBuf - Netty buffer containing the data

Task Description: Create a Java class that manages TCP client connections using Netty framework, handling connection establishment, error handling, and resource cleanup.

Class Description: NetService is a connection management class that maintains and reuses TCP connections to remote locations using Netty's non-blocking I/O. It provides thread-safe connection pooling and handles connection lifecycle including handshake, authentication, and graceful shutdown.

Attributes:
- connections: ConcurrentHashMap<Location, Connection> - Thread-safe map storing active connections keyed by remote location

Methods:
- connect(Location location) -> Connection - Establishes or reuses a TCP connection to the specified location. Handles connection initialization, handshake, and authentication. Returns the established connection.
  Input: 
    - location: Location - The remote endpoint to connect to
  Output: 
    - Connection - The established or existing connection object

The implementation should:
1. Use Netty's Bootstrap for client configuration
2. Employ NioEventLoopGroup for I/O thread management
3. Configure TCP_NODELAY for low-latency communication
4. Handle connection errors and interruptions
5. Implement connection pooling with automatic cleanup
6. Support connection handshake and authentication
7. Provide graceful shutdown of resources
8. Maintain thread safety through ConcurrentHashMap

Task Description: Create a Java class that implements a TCP client using Netty framework to connect to a server, send requests, and receive responses, with optional SSL support.

Class Description: FactorialClient is a Netty-based TCP client that connects to a server to calculate factorials. It handles SSL configuration, connection management, and graceful shutdown of resources.

Attributes:
- SSL: boolean - Flag indicating whether SSL encryption should be used
- HOST: String - The host address of the server to connect to (default: "127.0.0.1")
- PORT: int - The port number of the server (default: 8322)
- COUNT: int - The number for which factorial should be calculated (default: 1000)

Methods:
- start(): void - Initializes and starts the Netty client. Configures SSL if enabled, establishes connection to server, and handles the factorial calculation request. Throws Exception if any error occurs during the process.
  - Input: None
  - Output: None (prints result to System.err)

Task Description: Create a Java class that implements a TCP client using Netty framework for establishing non-blocking network connections to a remote server.

Class Description: The NettyTcpClient class provides functionality to create and manage TCP client connections using Netty's asynchronous event-driven network framework. It handles connection establishment, pipeline configuration, and resource cleanup.

Attributes:
- eventLoopGroup: [NioEventLoopGroup] - Manages the event processing threads for the client
- bootstrap: [Bootstrap] - The main configuration object for the Netty client

Methods:
- NettyTcpClient(): [Constructor] -> [void] - Initializes the client with a new NioEventLoopGroup and Bootstrap instance
- configureBootstrap(): [void]() -> [void] - Configures the bootstrap with channel type and event loop group
- connect(int port, String host, Consumer<Connection> handler): [ChannelFuture](int, String, Consumer<Connection>) -> [ChannelFuture] - Establishes a connection to the specified host and port, allowing for pipeline configuration via the handler
- shutdown(): [void]() -> [void] - Shuts down the event loop group gracefully to release resources

Nested Class:
- Connection: [static class] - Represents an established connection with channel and HTTP/2 components
  Attributes:
    - channel: [Channel] - The network channel
    - context: [ChannelHandlerContext] - The handler context
    - connection: [Http2Connection] - HTTP/2 connection object
    - encoder: [Http2ConnectionEncoder] - HTTP/2 encoder
    - decoder: [Http2ConnectionDecoder] - HTTP/2 decoder
  Methods:
    - Connection(ChannelHandlerContext, Http2Connection, Http2ConnectionEncoder, Http2ConnectionDecoder): [Constructor] -> [void] - Creates a new connection instance
    - nextStreamId(): [int]() -> [int] - Gets the next available stream ID for HTTP/2 communication

Task Description: Create a Java class that implements a TCP client using Netty framework to establish non-blocking connections to a remote server, handle message processing through a configurable pipeline, and ensure proper resource cleanup.

Class Description: The MocoClient class provides a reusable TCP client implementation using Netty's non-blocking I/O capabilities. It manages connection lifecycle, channel configuration, and graceful shutdown of network resources.

Attributes:
- None (This is a stateless client implementation where all configuration is passed through method parameters)

Methods:
- run(String host, int port, ChannelHandler pipelineFactory) -> void - Main method that initializes and runs the Netty client. It takes the server host address, port number, and a pipeline factory for configuring message handlers. The method establishes the connection, waits for it to close, and ensures proper resource cleanup. Throws MocoException if interrupted during operation.

The method performs these key operations:
1. Creates NioEventLoopGroup for I/O thread management
2. Configures Bootstrap with NioSocketChannel and connection parameters
3. Sets TCP_NODELAY option for low-latency communication
4. Applies the provided pipeline factory for message handling
5. Establishes connection and waits for channel closure
6. Implements graceful shutdown in finally block

Task Description: Create a Java class that implements a TCP client using Netty framework to establish non-blocking connections, send messages to a server, and handle graceful shutdown.

Class Description: The EchoClient class provides functionality to connect to a TCP server, send messages, and manage client resources. It uses Netty's non-blocking I/O for efficient communication.

Attributes:
- hostName: [String] - The hostname or IP address of the server to connect to
- portNumber: [int] - The port number of the server to connect to
- group: [EventLoopGroup] - Netty event loop group for managing I/O threads
- channel: [Channel] - The active network channel for communication with the server

Methods:
- connect(): [void] - Establishes a connection to the specified server using Netty's Bootstrap. Initializes the event loop group and configures the client pipeline.
- sendMessage(message: [String]): [void] - Converts the input string to a ByteBuf and sends it to the connected server through the active channel.
- startConsoleInput(): [void] - Reads input from the console and sends it to the server line by line until terminated. Handles IO exceptions.

Attributes:

- `shutdown()`: void - Gracefully shuts down the client by closing the active channel and releasing event loop resources (annotated with @PreDestroy for Spring lifecycle management).
- `send(Invocation invocation)`: void - Sends a message to the server through the active channel. Validates channel state before sending.

It configures the client pipeline with string encoders/decoders and a custom handler for file operations. The client continuously reads input from the console and sends it to the server.

Attributes:
host: String - The hostname or IP address of the remote server to connect to
port: int - The port number of the remote server
dest: String - The destination path for file operations (used by the client handler)

Methods:
run(): void - throws InterruptedException, IOException - Main method that initializes the Netty client, establishes connection, and handles message sending
  - Input: None
  - Output: None (but may throw InterruptedException or IOException)
  
FileClient(String, int, String) - Constructor that initializes the client with connection parameters
  - Input:
    - host: String - Server hostname/IP
    - port: int - Server port
    - dest: String - File destination path
  - Output: FileClient instance (constructor)

Task Description: Create a Java class that implements a TCP client using Netty framework to connect to a Docker daemon, with support for SSL/TLS encryption and timeout handling.

Class Description: The NettyTcpClient class provides functionality to establish and manage TCP connections to a Docker daemon using Netty framework. It handles connection initialization, SSL/TLS configuration, timeout management, and graceful shutdown.

Attributes:
- bootstrap: Bootstrap - Netty's client bootstrap for connection configuration
- eventLoopGroup: EventLoopGroup - Manages client-side I/O threads
- connectTimeout: Integer - Connection timeout in milliseconds
- readTimeout: Integer - Read operation timeout in milliseconds
- threadPrefix: String - Prefix for Netty thread names

Methods:
- init(DockerClientConfig dockerClientConfig) -> void - Initializes the Netty client with Docker configuration
- connect(DockerClientConfig dockerClientConfig) -> DuplexChannel - Establishes connection to Docker daemon with SSL support
- initSsl(DockerClientConfig dockerClientConfig) -> SslHandler - Configures SSL/TLS for the connection
- enableHostNameVerification(SSLParameters sslParameters) -> SSLParameters - Enables hostname verification in SSL parameters
- close() -> void - Shuts down the client gracefully
- configure(T channel) -> T - Configures channel timeouts and handlers
- ReadTimeoutHandler() -> void - Inner class handling read timeout events

Task Description: Create a Java class that implements a TCP client using Netty framework to establish secure or non-secure connections to a remote server, with capabilities for graceful shutdown.

- shutdown() -> [void] - Shuts down the client gracefully and releases all resources

Task Description: Create a Java class that implements a TCP client using Netty framework to establish a connection with a remote server, send periodic messages, and handle graceful shutdown.

Task Description: Create a Java class that implements a TCP client using Netty framework to connect to a remote server, handle network communication, and manage resources properly.

Task Description: Create a Java class that implements a TCP client using Netty framework to establish a connection with a remote server, handle SSL/TLS if required, and process incoming/outgoing messages.

Task Description: Implement a Java class that establishes a TCP server using Netty framework to handle WebSocket connections, manage client protocols, and process various commands and binary messages.

Class Description: LocalServer is a Netty-based TCP server that handles WebSocket connections, manages client protocols, and processes text/binary messages. It maintains a list of active protocols and delegates command execution to connected clients.

- port: int - The port number on which the server listens for incoming connections
- protocolList: List<Protocol> - Maintains active client protocols and their associated connections
- logger: Logger - Logging instance for server events and errors

Methods:

- listen(int port) -> void - Sets the server's listening port
- start() -> void - Starts the Netty server with boss/worker groups, configures channel options and handlers, and binds to the specified port
- LocalServerWebsocketEventImp (inner class) - Handles WebSocket events including connection, disconnection, and message processing

LocalServerWebsocketEventImp Methods:
- onConnect(ChannelHandlerContext ctx) -> void - Handles new WebSocket connections
- onDisconnect(ChannelHandlerContext ctx) -> void - Handles client disconnections and cleans up associated protocols

- onBinaryMessage(ChannelHandlerContext ctx, byte[] data) -> void - Handles binary file uploads and processes file chunks
- initLocalClient(ChannelHandlerContext ctx, Command command) -> void - Initializes a new client protocol for device communication
- executeCommand(ChannelHandlerContext ctx, Command command) -> void - Executes commands on the appropriate protocol instance

Task Description: Create a Java class that implements a TCP server using Netty framework to handle HTTP requests for static file serving, with optional SSL support.

Task Description: Implement a Netty-based TCP server for RPC (Remote Procedure Call) communication that handles incoming client connections, processes RPC requests, and manages server resources efficiently.

Task Description: Implement a Netty-based TCP server class that can handle incoming client connections, support SSL/TLS encryption, and provide graceful shutdown capabilities.

Class Description: The NettyServer class is responsible for creating and managing a TCP server using Netty framework. It handles server initialization, SSL configuration (if enabled), thread pool management, and proper resource cleanup during shutdown.

- bossGroup: [EventLoopGroup] - Netty event loop group for accepting connections
- workerGroup: [EventLoopGroup] - Netty event loop group for handling I/O operations

- DEFAULT_IO_THREAD_COUNT: [int] - Default number of threads for I/O operations

Task Description: Create a Java class that implements an HTTP server using Netty framework, capable of handling HTTP requests with configurable thread pool settings and connection management.

Class Description: Netty4HttpServer is a Netty-based HTTP server implementation that handles incoming HTTP requests using configurable worker threads and connection pooling. It extends AbstractServer and implements StatisticCallback for monitoring purposes.

- url: URL - Server configuration URL containing parameters like port, thread settings
- channel: Channel - Netty channel for server communication

- workerGroup: EventLoopGroup - Netty event loop group for handling I/O operations

  Input: None
  Output: boolean indicating success/failure of server startup

- close(int timeout) -> void - Shuts down the server gracefully within specified timeout
  Input: timeout - maximum time to wait for shutdown (in milliseconds)
  Output: None

- processHttpRequest(ChannelHandlerContext ctx, FullHttpRequest httpRequest) -> void - Processes incoming HTTP requests
  Input: 
    ctx - ChannelHandlerContext for the connection
    httpRequest - Full HTTP request object
  Output: None

- sendResponse(ChannelHandlerContext ctx, FullHttpResponse httpResponse) -> void - Sends HTTP response to client
  Input:
    ctx - ChannelHandlerContext for the connection
    httpResponse - Full HTTP response object
  Output: None

- getUrl() -> URL - Returns server configuration URL
  Input: None
  Output: URL object containing server configuration

Task Description: Create a Java class that implements a Netty-based HTTP server for handling RPC (Remote Procedure Call) requests. The server should manage incoming connections, process HTTP requests, and handle server lifecycle events (start/stop).

Class Description: NettyHttpServer is a server implementation that uses Netty framework to create a non-blocking HTTP server capable of handling RPC requests. It manages thread pools for request processing and implements proper resource cleanup during shutdown.

Attributes:
- thread: Thread - The thread in which the Netty server runs
- logger: Logger - Logger instance for server events (inherited from parent class)

Methods:
- start(XxlRpcProviderFactory) -> void - Starts the Netty HTTP server on a specified port, initializes thread pools, and sets up request handlers
  - Input: xxlRpcProviderFactory - Configuration factory containing server parameters like port number and thread pool sizes
  - Output: None (server runs asynchronously in a separate thread)
  
- stop() -> void - Stops the server gracefully by interrupting the server thread and shutting down all resources
  - Input: None
  - Output: None (performs cleanup operations)

The implementation should follow Netty best practices including:
1. Using separate event loop groups for connection acceptance and request processing
2. Proper channel pipeline configuration with HTTP codecs and aggregator
3. Idle connection handling
4. Graceful shutdown of all resources
5. Thread pool management for request processing
6. Proper error handling and logging

Task Description: Create a Java class that implements a TCP server using Netty framework to handle incoming client connections and process requests.

Task Description: Create a Java class that implements a MySQL-compatible Netty TCP server to handle client connections and MySQL protocol communication.

Class Description: The MysqlNettyServer class is a Netty-based TCP server that handles MySQL protocol connections. It manages client connections, processes MySQL protocol messages, and maintains connection state. The server uses Netty's non-blocking I/O model for high performance.

Attributes:
- host: String - The host address the server binds to (nullable)
- port: int - The port number the server listens on
- connections: static Map<String, MysqlConnection> - Thread-safe map storing active MySQL connections by connection ID
- eventLoopGroup: EventLoopGroup - Netty event loop group for handling I/O operations
- server: ServerBootstrap - Netty server bootstrap instance for server configuration

Methods:
- start() -> void - Starts the Netty server, binds to the specified host and port, and begins accepting connections. Throws Exception if binding fails.
- channelInitializer() -> ChannelInitializer<SocketChannel> - Creates and returns a channel initializer that sets up the pipeline for new connections, including handlers for MySQL protocol processing.
- close() -> void - Shuts down the server gracefully by closing all connections and releasing resources.

The class uses Netty's NIO transport and includes handlers for:
1. MySQL handshake protocol
2. MySQL message decoding
3. Connection idle state management
4. MySQL command processing
5. Exception handling

The server maintains thread-safe tracking of active connections and automatically cleans up closed connections.

Task Description: Implement a Netty-based TCP server class that handles incoming client connections and processes requests using a RESTful service configuration.

Task Description: Create a Java class that provides file channel operations using Java NIO's FileChannel for efficient file I/O operations, including reading, writing, positioning, truncating, and memory mapping.

Class Description: TranslogFileChannel is a wrapper class for FileChannel that simplifies file operations while maintaining the performance benefits of Java NIO. It implements Closeable to ensure proper resource cleanup.

Attributes:
- location: Path - The file path associated with the FileChannel
- channel: FileChannel - The underlying FileChannel instance for performing I/O operations

Methods:
- TranslogFileChannel(Path location) -> void - Constructor that opens a FileChannel for both reading and writing at the specified path
- write(ByteBuffer src) -> void - Writes data from the given ByteBuffer to the file
- read(ByteBuffer dst) -> int - Reads data from the file into the given ByteBuffer, returning the number of bytes read
- position() -> long - Returns the current position in the file
- position(long newPosition) -> void - Sets the position in the file
- size() -> long - Returns the current size of the file
- truncate(long size) -> void - Truncates the file to the specified size
- force(boolean metaData) -> void - Forces any updates to be written to the storage device
- transferTo(long position, long count, WritableByteChannel target) -> long - Transfers bytes from this channel to the given writable channel
- transferFrom(ReadableByteChannel src, long position, long count) -> long - Transfers bytes into this channel from the given readable channel
- map(FileChannel.MapMode mode, long position, long size) -> MappedByteBuffer - Maps a region of this channel's file directly into memory
- close() -> void - Closes the FileChannel and releases associated resources

Task Description: Implement an asynchronous file handling class in Java using NIO's AsynchronousFileChannel for non-blocking file operations, supporting both reading and writing with various file opening options.

The class uses Netty's NIO transport and includes HTTP-specific handlers for proper protocol handling. It maintains proper resource management through graceful shutdown mechanisms.

- workerGroup: [NioEventLoopGroup] - Handles I/O operations for established connections
- serverChannel: [Channel] - Represents the server's listening channel
- messageHandler: [MessageHandler] - Processes incoming requests
- standardThreadExecutor: [StandardThreadExecutor] - Manages worker threads for request processing
- rejectCounter: [AtomicInteger] - Tracks rejected requests count
- channelManage: [NettyServerChannelManage] - Manages active connections

Methods:
- open() -> [boolean] - Starts the server, initializes thread pools, binds to port, and sets up channel pipeline. Returns true if successful.
- close() -> [void] - Shuts down the server gracefully, releasing all resources including thread pools and channels.
- isBound() -> [boolean] - Checks if server is actively listening for connections.
- request(Request) -> [Response] - Throws MotanFrameworkException as server doesn't support direct requests (inherited from AbstractServer).

Input:
- URL url: Configuration parameters for server setup (port, thread counts, queue sizes etc.)
- MessageHandler messageHandler: Handler for processing incoming messages

Output:
- When open() succeeds: Server starts listening on specified port and returns true
- When close() completes: All server resources are released and state set to CLOSE
- isBound(): Returns current server binding status

Task Description: Create a Java class that implements a TCP server using Netty framework to handle HTTP requests. The server should be configurable to listen on a specified port and properly manage its resources.

Class Description: HttpServer is a Netty-based TCP server implementation that handles HTTP requests. It manages server lifecycle including startup, shutdown, and resource cleanup. The server uses a boss-worker thread model for handling connections and requests efficiently.

Attributes:

- bossGroup: EventLoopGroup - The parent thread group that accepts incoming connections
- workerGroup: EventLoopGroup - The child thread group that handles the traffic of accepted connections

Methods:
- start(int port) -> void - Starts the server on the specified port. Initializes thread groups, configures server options, and binds to the port. Throws Exception if startup fails.
- stop() -> void - Shuts down the server gracefully by releasing all thread resources
- main(String[] args) -> void - Entry point that parses command line arguments for port number and starts the server

Task Description: Create a Java class that implements a TCP server using Netty framework, capable of handling HTTP requests with configurable thread pools and graceful shutdown capabilities.

Task Description: Implement a Java class that interacts with GitHub's OAuth API to obtain an access token and retrieve user information using the OkHttp library for HTTP requests.

Task Description: Implement a Java NIO HTTP server that handles client connections asynchronously, processes incoming requests, and sends responses back to clients. The server should use non-blocking I/O operations managed by a Selector to efficiently handle multiple connections.

Task Description: Implement a non-blocking HTTP server using Java NIO (New I/O) that can handle multiple client connections concurrently. The server should be able to accept new connections, read incoming requests, and write responses asynchronously using separate threads for different operations.

Attributes:

- selector: Selector - The selector for accepting new client connections

- clientWriteSelector: Selector - The selector for handling write operations to clients

- ClientReadChannelThread(Selector clientReadSelector, Selector clientWriteSelector) -> void - Nested class that handles reading incoming requests from clients and registers them with the write selector when ready to respond
- ClientWriteChannelThread(Selector clientReadSelector, Selector clientWriteSelector) -> void - Nested class that handles writing responses to clients and registers them back with the read selector when done

Task Description: Create utility functions for working with FileChannel in Java NIO to provide OutputStream functionality with optional force-write capability at close.

Nested Interfaces:

Task Description: Implement a utility class for executing external processes synchronously and asynchronously in Java, handling input/output streams properly to prevent deadlocks, and collecting process output.

Task Description: Implement a memory-mapped file-based key-value store for long-to-long mappings using Java NIO's FileChannel and MappedByteBuffer.

Class Description: ArrayLongLongMapMmap provides a memory-efficient way to store and retrieve long-to-long mappings using memory-mapped files. It segments large files into manageable chunks for efficient random access.

Attributes:
- path: Path - The filesystem path where the memory-mapped file will be stored
- writeChannel: FileChannel - Channel for writing to the file during initialization
- segmentsArray: MappedByteBuffer[] - Array of memory-mapped buffers for reading data

Methods:
- ArrayLongLongMapMmap(Path path, boolean madvise) - Constructor - Initializes the map with the given file path
- init() -> void - Initializes the memory mapping by closing the write channel and opening read channels with segmented mappings
- get(long key) -> long - Retrieves the value associated with the given key from memory-mapped segments
- close() -> void - Cleans up resources including unmapping buffers and closing channels, then deletes the file

The implementation uses memory-mapped files (1<<27 byte segments) for efficient random access to large datasets while minimizing memory usage. The close() method ensures proper resource cleanup including buffer unmapping and file deletion.

Task Description: Implement a WebSocket server endpoint in Java to handle real-time communication between clients, manage client connections, and broadcast messages to all connected clients.

   - Output: String - The command string read from the stream

     2. Converts bytes to characters
     3. Stops reading at carriage return ('\r')
     4. Returns accumulated string

3. write(OutputStream os):
   - Input:

Task Description: Create a Java class that handles HTTP requests asynchronously to fetch data from a given URL and process the response as a JSON object.

MyAsyncTaskgetNews:
- Input Parameters: String... params (varargs where params[0] should be the URL string)
- Return Type: String (though it primarily works through side effects)
- Description: 
  1. Creates a URL object from the input string
  2. Opens an HttpURLConnection with a 7-second timeout
  3. Reads the input stream and converts it to a string
  4. Publishes the result for JSON processing in onProgressUpdate
  5. Disconnects the connection when done

ConvertInputToStringNoChange:
- Input Parameters: InputStream inputStream (the stream to read from)
- Return Type: String (the concatenated content of the stream)
- Description:
  1. Creates a BufferedReader from the InputStream
  2. Reads all lines and concatenates them into a single string
  3. Closes the input stream
  4. Returns the concatenated string

Class Description: The UDPClient class is designed to handle UDP communication as a client. It creates a UDP socket bound to a specific port, receives incoming packets, processes the data, and provides information about the sender. The class includes methods for receiving data and cleaning up resources.

Attributes:
- socket: DatagramSocket - The UDP socket used for communication
- packet: DatagramPacket - The packet object used for receiving data
- buffer: byte[] - The buffer used to store incoming packet data

Methods:
- UDPClient(int port) -> void - Constructor that initializes the UDP client. Takes a port number as input to bind the socket.
  - port: int - The port number to bind the socket to
- receiveData() -> String - Receives a UDP packet, extracts the data, and returns it along with sender information
  - Returns: String - The received data concatenated with sender's IP address and port
- close() -> void - Closes the socket and releases system resources

Task Description: Create a UDP communication class that can function as either a server or client, handling packet transmission and reception with proper error handling and resource management.

Class Description: UDPCommunicator is a class that encapsulates UDP communication functionality, allowing an instance to operate as either a server (receiving packets) or client (sending packets). The class manages socket creation, packet transmission/reception, and proper cleanup.

Attributes:
- socket: DatagramSocket - The underlying UDP socket used for communication
- isServer: boolean - Flag indicating whether this instance operates as a server (true) or client (false)

Methods:
- UDPCommunicator(boolean isServer, int port) -> void - Constructor that initializes the UDP socket. Binds to specified port if operating as server.
- sendPacket(byte[] data, String destAddress, int destPort) -> void - Sends a UDP packet to the specified destination (client mode only). Throws IOException on network errors and IllegalStateException if called in server mode.
- receivePacket() -> byte[] - Receives a UDP packet (server mode only). Returns the packet data as byte array. Throws IOException on network errors and IllegalStateException if called in client mode.
- close() -> void - Closes the socket and releases system resources. Safe to call multiple times.

Task Description: Create a Kafka topic using the AdminClient API in Java.

Function Description: This function creates a new Kafka topic with the specified name, number of partitions, and replication factor. It uses the Kafka AdminClient to interact with the Kafka broker and handles potential exceptions during the topic creation process.

Input: 
- topic: String - The name of the Kafka topic to be created.

Output: 
- void - The function does not return any value but creates the topic in Kafka and stores the AdminClient instance in the class field.

Exceptions:
- InterruptedException: If the thread is interrupted while waiting for the topic creation to complete.
- ExecutionException: If the topic creation fails during execution.
- TimeoutException: If the topic creation takes longer than the specified timeout period.

Task Description: Create a Java class for UDP socket communication that can be used for both sending and receiving datagram packets. The class should handle socket creation, binding, message transmission, and reception with proper error handling.

Class Description: HTTPUSocket is a UDP socket wrapper class that provides simplified methods for UDP communication. It manages socket lifecycle and provides methods for sending messages to specific addresses and receiving incoming packets.

- HTTPUSocket(int bindPort) -> void - Constructor that binds socket to specific port on all interfaces
- getDatagramSocket() -> DatagramSocket - Returns the underlying DatagramSocket instance
- setLocalAddress(String addr) -> void - Sets the local address manually
- getLocalAddress() -> String - Returns the local address bound to the socket
- open() -> boolean - Creates an unbound UDP socket, returns success status
- open(String bindAddr, int bindPort) -> boolean - Binds socket to specific address and port, returns success status
- open(int bindPort) -> boolean - Binds socket to specific port on all interfaces, returns success status

Task Description: Create a Java class that implements UDP communication functionality for sending and receiving packets, with configurable buffer size and port management.

Task Description: Create a UDP server class that listens for incoming packets on a specified port, processes the received data, and provides a method to retrieve the received message.

Class Description: The UdpServer class implements a Runnable interface to handle UDP communication asynchronously. It creates a datagram socket bound to a specified port, receives incoming packets, stores the message content, and allows retrieval of the received message. The server operates with a timeout of 60 seconds.

Task Description: Implement a class that provides UDP-based network communication for device discovery and identity exchange in a local area network (LAN) environment, supporting both server (listener) and client (broadcaster) functionalities.

Class Description: LanLinkProvider is a class that handles UDP communication for device discovery in a LAN. It listens for identity broadcasts from other devices and broadcasts its own identity. It manages socket creation, packet handling, and network trust verification.

- context: [Context] - Android context for accessing device information and preferences
- udpServer: [DatagramSocket] - UDP socket for receiving broadcast packets
- listening: [boolean] - Flag indicating whether the UDP listener is active
- UDP_PORT: [static final int] - Default UDP port for communication (1716)
- MIN_PORT: [static final int] - Minimum valid TCP port number (1716)
- MAX_UDP_PACKET_SIZE: [static final int] - Maximum size of UDP packets (512KB)

Methods:
- setupUdpListener() -> [void] - Sets up and starts a UDP listener thread that continuously receives packets
- udpPacketReceived(DatagramPacket packet) -> [void] - Processes received UDP packets containing device identity information
- sendUdpIdentityPacket(List<InetAddress> ipList, @Nullable Network network) -> [void] - Broadcasts device identity to specified IP addresses
- configureSocket(Socket socket) -> [void] - Configures socket settings (keep-alive)

Task Description: Implement a UDP client class in Java that can send UDP packets to a specified target address and port, with optional response waiting functionality.

Class Description: The UDPClient class provides functionality to send UDP packets to a network target. It supports both fire-and-forget mode and request-response mode. The class manages its own socket and thread for asynchronous operation, and includes cleanup mechanisms.

Attributes:
- mUdpSocket: DatagramSocket - The UDP socket used for communication
- mRunning: boolean - Flag indicating whether the client is currently active
- mThread: Thread - The thread handling the UDP communication

Methods:
- sendUDPPacket(String targetAddress, int port, String data, boolean waitResponse, ResponseHandler handler) -> void - 
  Sends a UDP packet to the specified address and port. If waitResponse is true, it will wait for and deliver any response.
  Parameters:
    - targetAddress: String - The IP address or hostname of the target
    - port: int - The destination port number
    - data: String - The message to send
    - waitResponse: boolean - Whether to wait for a response
    - handler: ResponseHandler - Callback interface for handling responses or errors

- stop() -> void - 
  Stops any ongoing UDP communication and cleans up resources. Closes the socket and interrupts the thread if active.

- interface ResponseHandler - 
  Callback interface for handling responses or errors
  Methods:
    - onResponse(String response) -> void - Called when a response is received
    - onError(String errorMessage) -> void - Called when an error occurs

Task Description: Implement a UDP-based tracker server that handles client connections and announcements for a peer-to-peer network, managing connection IDs and responding to client requests with appropriate status information.

Task Description: Implement a UDP-based client class for network communication that can send and receive datagram packets, manage connections, and handle timeouts.

Task Description: Implement a UDP-based tracker client for peer-to-peer file sharing systems that can connect to a tracker server, maintain connection state, and handle announce requests and responses.

Task Description: Implement a DNS UDP client class that can resolve DNS queries (A records and TXT records) by communicating with DNS servers over UDP.

Class Description: The DnsUdpClient class provides functionality to send DNS queries to specified DNS servers and process the responses. It supports resolving domain names to IPv4 addresses (A records) and retrieving text records (TXT records).

DNS_SERVERS: InetSocketAddress[] - An array of predefined DNS server addresses with their respective ports

Methods:
resolveAOverUdp: resolveAOverUdp(InetSocketAddress dnsServer, byte[] query) -> List<Inet4Address> - Resolves a DNS A record query by sending it to the specified DNS server and returns a list of IPv4 addresses. Throws Exception if the operation fails.

toIps: toIps(byte[] buffer) -> List<Inet4Address> - Helper method that converts DNS response data into a list of IPv4 addresses by parsing A records.

resolveTXTOverUdp: resolveTXTOverUdp(InetSocketAddress dnsServer, byte[] query) -> String - Resolves a DNS TXT record query by sending it to the specified DNS server and returns the text content. Throws Exception if the operation fails.

toTXT: toTXT(byte[] buffer) -> String - Helper method that extracts TXT record data from DNS response and returns it as a string. Throws RuntimeException if no TXT record is found.

Task Description: Create a Java utility class for making HTTP POST requests with JSON payloads, handling both HTTP and HTTPS connections, including SSL certificate verification bypass for HTTPS, and processing JSON responses.

Class Description: XxlJobRemotingUtil is a utility class designed to handle remote HTTP communication with JSON payloads, particularly for interacting with the XXL-JOB scheduler. It provides methods for making POST requests with proper headers, timeout settings, and access token authentication.

Attributes:
- logger: Logger - SLF4J logger for error and debug logging
- XXL_JOB_ACCESS_TOKEN: String - Constant string for the access token header name
- trustAllCerts: TrustManager[] - Array of trust managers that don't validate certificates

Methods:
- trustAllHosts(HttpsURLConnection connection) -> void - Configures the HTTPS connection to trust all hosts and certificates
- postBody(String url, String accessToken, int timeout, Object requestObj, Class returnTargClassOfT) -> ReturnT - Makes an HTTP POST request with JSON payload and processes the JSON response

Method Details:
1. trustAllHosts(HttpsURLConnection connection) -> void
   - Input: HttpsURLConnection connection - The HTTPS connection to configure
   - Description: Sets up SSL context to trust all certificates and hosts for the given HTTPS connection

2. postBody(String url, String accessToken, int timeout, Object requestObj, Class returnTargClassOfT) -> ReturnT
   - Input:
     - url: String - The target URL for the POST request
     - accessToken: String - Authentication token for the request
     - timeout: int - Read timeout in seconds
     - requestObj: Object - The object to be serialized as JSON request body
     - returnTargClassOfT: Class - The class type for deserializing the response
   - Output: ReturnT - A generic return type containing either the successful response or error information
   - Description: 
     1. Creates and configures an HTTP/HTTPS connection
     2. Sets request headers including content type and access token
     3. Serializes the request object to JSON and sends it
     4. Reads and deserializes the JSON response
     5. Handles errors and connection cleanup

- adminClient: AdminClient - The Kafka AdminClient instance used for topic management operations

Methods:
- createAndConfigureAdminClient(String bootstrapServers) -> AdminClient - Creates and configures a Kafka AdminClient instance with the specified bootstrap servers
- autoCreateMetricsTopic(AdminClient adminClient, String topicName) -> TopicDescription - Creates a new Kafka topic with default configuration (1 partition and replication factor of 1) and returns its description

Task Description: Create a function that performs an HTTP GET request to a specified URL and returns the response as a string.

Function Description: The function should establish an HTTP connection to the provided URL, send a GET request, read the response stream, and return the content as a UTF-8 encoded string. It should handle resource cleanup properly by closing all streams and disconnecting the HTTP connection.

Input: 
- requestUrl: String - The URL to which the HTTP GET request will be sent

Output: 
- String - The response content from the HTTP GET request, or null if an error occurs

Task Description: Create a Java class that handles HTTP requests (GET and POST) to a REST API, with support for custom headers, query parameters, and JSON serialization/deserialization.

Class Description: The ApiHandler class provides a convenient way to make HTTP requests to a REST API endpoint. It supports both GET and POST methods, handles query parameters, includes custom headers (like API keys), and automatically serializes/deserializes JSON data using Gson. The class maintains a base URL and optional additional headers that are included in every request.

Attributes:
- baseUrl: String - The base URL for all API requests
- additionalHeaders: Map<String, String> - Optional headers to include in all requests

Methods:
- Constructor: ApiHandler(String url) - Initializes the handler with a base URL
- Constructor: ApiHandler(String url, String apiKey) - Initializes with base URL and sets an API key header
- get: <T> get(String endpoint, Class<T> tClass) -> T - Makes a GET request to the endpoint and returns deserialized response
- get: <T> get(String endpoint, HashMap<String, Object> query, Class<T> tClass) -> T - Makes a GET request with query parameters
- post: <T> post(String endpoint, T body, Class<T> tClass) -> T - Makes a POST request with a request body
- post: <T> post(String endpoint, HashMap<String, Object> query, T body, Class<T> tClass) -> T - Makes a POST request with query parameters and body
- getRaw: static String getRaw(Map<String, String> headers, String url) -> String - Makes a raw GET request and returns response as string
- postRaw: static String postRaw(Map<String, String> headers, String url, String body) -> String - Makes a raw POST request and returns response as string
- addHeaders: static void addHeaders(HttpURLConnection connection, Map<String, String> headers) - Helper to add headers to a connection
- parseQueries: static String parseQueries(HashMap<String, Object> query) -> String - Converts query parameters to URL encoded string
- getFullUrl: static <T> T getFullUrl(Map<String, String> headers, String url, Class<T> tClass) -> T - Makes GET request to full URL and deserializes response
- getFullUrl: static <T> T getFullUrl(Map<String, String> headers, String url, HashMap<String, Object> query, Class<T> tClass) -> T - GET with query params to full URL
- postFullUrl: static <T> T postFullUrl(Map<String, String> headers, String url, T body, Class<T> tClass) -> T - POST to full URL with body
- postFullUrl: static <T> T postFullUrl(Map<String, String> headers, String url, HashMap<String, Object> query, T body, Class<T> tClass) -> T - POST with query params to full URL
- urlEncodeUTF8: static String urlEncodeUTF8(String input) -> String - URL encodes a string using UTF-8

Task Description: Implement a Java class that provides remote service capabilities for retrieving knowledge packages from a repository server using HTTP communication.

Class Description: RemoteServiceImpl is a service class that handles HTTP communication with a remote repository server to fetch knowledge packages. It manages the connection, request/response handling, and data processing.

Attributes:
- resporityServerUrl: String - The base URL of the remote repository server
- log: Logger - Logger instance for logging information and errors

Methods:
- getKnowledge(String packageId, String timestamp) -> KnowledgePackage - Retrieves a knowledge package from the remote server using the specified package ID and timestamp
- sendRequest(String packageId, String timestamp) -> String - Internal method that handles the HTTP request/response cycle with the remote server
- setResporityServerUrl(String resporityServerUrl) -> void - Sets the repository server URL, appending the default endpoint if not present

Task Description: Create a Java HTTP client class that handles HTTP/HTTPS requests with support for proxies, custom headers, cookies, and request body configuration. The class should manage SSL verification, connection timeouts, and proper resource cleanup.

Class Description: The HttpClient class provides functionality to send HTTP requests and receive responses. It handles SSL certificate verification (with optional bypass), proxy configuration, request customization, and response processing. The class maintains static configuration and includes utility methods for connection management.

Attributes:

config: [Config] - Singleton instance holding configuration settings like proxy information and cookie names

Methods:

sendRequest: [sendRequest]([HttpRequestInfo httpRequestInfo, String cookieValue]) -> [String] - Main method to send HTTP requests. Takes request info and cookie value, returns response body as string or null on failure.

createConnection: [createConnection]([HttpRequestInfo httpRequestInfo]) -> [HttpURLConnection] - Creates and returns a connection object, optionally through a proxy if configured.

configureRequest: [configureRequest]([HttpURLConnection connection, HttpRequestInfo httpRequestInfo, String cookieValue]) -> [void] - Configures request method, headers, and cookies on the connection object.

configureCookie: [configureCookie]([Map<String,String> headers, String cookieValue]) -> [void] - Handles cookie manipulation in request headers.

sendRequestBody: [sendRequestBody]([HttpURLConnection connection, HttpRequestInfo httpRequestInfo]) -> [void] - Sends request body data if present in the request info.

closeResources: [closeResources]([HttpURLConnection connection, InputStream inputStream, ByteArrayOutputStream baos]) -> [void] - Safely closes all connection-related resources.
